constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 21 (Thursday, February 4, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. HAALAND:
H.R. 813.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, section 8, Clause 7 of the United States
Constitution, to establish post offices and post roads.
[Page H387]

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1050 Sunset Road Southwest in Albuquerque, New Mexico, as the Jose Hernandez Post Office Building.
